boat.construction_details: Carvel Pitch Pine on sawn and bent oak frames

for_sales.sales_text:
1896 Solent One-Design, completely professionally re-built and restored 2009-2010 to the highest specification and similarly maintained by two very careful owners. Coated with epoxy inside and out and finished with epoxy paint and varnish. Mainsail and topsail by Lawrence, headsails by Sanders, spinnakers by Elvstrom and Hyde.

Navigational equipment includes compass, log, depth sounder and chart table. The fully upholstered interior and cockpit cushions were replaced in 2010.

Regularly serviced inboard Yanmar 1GM diesel with new bronze propeller 2010.

Excellent racing record (successes too many to list), a snip at this price.

boat.full_description:
Eilun went to France in 1908, and remained on the Atlantic coast in various harbours until after the Great War. Lloyds Register records she was re-named Rosenn at this time.

She returned to England in the Twenties and spent many years on or around the River Crouch. At times she has chartered. One notable charterer was John Profumo using her as a cruising boat. During her time on the Crouch, she underwent a major restoration. Her owner was a shipwright and was based up the river at Fambridge. She went on the market to allow her owner to purchase a boat more suited to long-distance cruising.

In May 2007, she was purchased by Barry Dunning and Bob Fisher, who, as part of the purchasing deal, arranged for her to be brought from the Crouch to Lymington. It was at this point that Rosenn reverted from cruising boat to racing boat her new owners were more interested in that aspect of the sport and a gradual metamorphosis began.

More recently she has been bought by Peter & Victoria Bonham Christie who gave her back her original name. She is currently racing succesfully in the Solent.
boat.name: Eilun
boat.short_description: Eilun is the last existing Solent One Design, one of the first One Design classes created. Twenty-two were built between 1896 & 1904 for members of the Royal Yacht Squadron and the Island Sailing Club. Eilun, is still racing and winning in the Solent.
